title: Simple Present or Present Continuous Tense Exercise

questions.question: Rani .......................... with her parents at the moment.
questions.description: We use the present continuous tense to talk about temporary states.

questions.question: My brother ......................... at a bank.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about jobs, habits, routines etc.

questions.question: I never .......................... up before 9 on Sunday mornings.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about our habits and routines.

questions.question: I ....................... people who ........................... rude to their subordinates.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about our likes, dislikes and preferences.

questions.question: I ......................... this music.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about our likes and dislikes.

questions.question: ............................. the meat ........................ bad?
questions.description: The verb smell is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I .............................. the dentist at 11 am.
questions.description: We use the present continuous tense to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: I ........................... what you mean?
questions.description: When see means understand, it is not used in the continuous form.

questions.question: He ........................... his dog out for a walk every day before breakfast.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about habits.

questions.question: If you ....................... too much coffee, you may develop health problems.
What time ................................ tomorrow?
questions.description: To talk about pre-planned events, we use the present continuous tense.

questions.question: How often ............................... to the movies?
questions.description: We use the simple present to ask about habits, routines etc.
